main event: A radar and visual sighting of an object over Albuquerque, New Mexico on January 21, 1952, which was preliminarily identified as a bolide or meteor.
interesting points: The object was observed on radar and a visual sighting was made in correlation.
The object exhibited characteristics consistent with a bolide or meteor, such as a small meteorite entering the Earth's atmosphere.
The sighting lasted for approximately 5-10 minutes.

The Albuquerque Journal reported that photographs were taken of a similar aerial object on January 29, 1954, but the undeveloped negatives were sent to Life magazine before the Air Force could obtain them.
The Director of Intelligence at Kirtland Air Force Base was in communication with Captain Ruppelt at the Air Technical Intelligence Center about the sighting and the missing photographs.
result: preliminary identification as a bolide or meteor
photographs: yes, but the photographs were sent to Life magazine and could not be obtained by the Air Force
